intro: Hedysarum uniflorum, commonly known as the single-flowered vetch, is a perennial leguminous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features compound leaves with three to five leaflets and produces small, yellow to orange flowers in late spring. The plant has a trailing growth habit and is often found in rocky or dry soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. Hedysarum uniflorum is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its potential health benefits.
